Reviews.Title: “Good value, roomy hotel in an expensive crowded city”
Reviews.Author: fidelityman
Reviews.Content: The Bauhinia Central turned out to be good value in a city with expensive hotel rooms. Situated in a side alley near a large department store, and close to the Sheung Wan MTR station, it is well located. The rooms are relatively large for budget hotels in Hong Kong, with great service. Coming from the airport, it is 10min walk from the Airport Express Hong Kong Station. However, after booking at Booking.com, when I checked in they raised the price on me. Not by much, but an unpleasant surprise. -1 star for that. 4stars otherwise - good service and a comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Functional and in good location”
Reviews.Author: Loren J
Reviews.Content: We took airport express into central station (24mins) then just walked to the hotel (5-10min) which wasnt too bad even with 2 luggages with wheels. Its pretty much one straight overhead bridge to the hotel but make sure your headed the right way as there are several exits and walkways. The rooms were clean, decent size, and had all the functional items you would require. Lounge on 4th floor was good with 2 flat TV's several options for complimentary coffee, reading materials, and 2 internet stations. The gym next door also looked decent for a boutique hotel and usable. No restaurant but not a problem as there are several coffee shops, bakeries, groceries all nearby. If you want something western we found a very good Pizzeria called Jacomax a few streets down,which looked to run by an Italian couple and very authentic. Another Italian called Amante was on the same street and was pretty decent. We had an event at the four seasons next to the IFC mall and was convenient to walk or taxi which was only (25 HKD) Took a day trip to Macau and the ferry terminal was also in walking distance. In the end you don't necessarily get the size or conveniences of a bigger chain hotels, but it had everything we needed and the location couldn't of been better.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ele E
Reviews.Content: HK is rather expensive and rooms are usually very small. The Bauhinia Hotel Central offers a very nice room, big enough to host two people, with a very nice bathroom (huge shower) and all kind of comfort (iPod station, plugs, tea, laundry, coffee machine,..). The location is right in the city centre near to a MTR stop. You can find starbucks and restaurants everywhere nearby the hotel. Moreover 10mins walking you find the restaurant street (Lan Kwai Fong) which is always interesting :) Bad points: 1. No view from some rooms since there is a building in front, but it doesn't really matter since you visit the city (moreover there should be one side with a nice view). 2. No wifi connection despite some websites (e.g.: booking.com) confirm there is. However our room on third floor could get a low signal and we were able to use the internet (slow).

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: uzzikie
Reviews.Content: 1 min away from Sheung Wan MTR Exit C 10 min walking distance to Hong Kong Station for Airport Express spacious room, for Hong Kong standards no noise from traffic despite next to a highway no wifi in room (despite advertised), except at guest lounge at 4th level

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Ali_Jo333
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late (after midnight) as we'd been visiting Macau for the evening, but it was still easy to check in. Staff were welcoming and polite. Room was quite large, clean and beautifully decorated. There was no noise at all. Hotel seemed well kept. It's also a good location for central and the ferry terminals. Only down point for this hotel was that it was very difficult to find. The entrance is on a side street and not the street that is used for their address. However, we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lisa G
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and smells good as soon as you step inside the lobby. The room is big and clean, there is essential toiletries provided, rain shower, big TV. Quiet even though it's located next to a main street whereby the bus trams stops. Check-in was quite smooth, the hotel staff allows you to keep your luggage there while you go sightseeing till the check-in time at 2pm. Likewise, upon checkout and your flight is at night, they will allow you to keep your luggage at the hotel till you are ready to leave for the airport. Remember to check out first. Hotel staff is so-so, does not really service with a smile. Could be friendlier towards Asians. Location was strategic as MTR Sheung Wan Station is just steps away. Tip: If you're coming from the airport, take the Airport Express MTR, stop at Hong Kong Station. Walk to Central Station and take the MTR to Sheung Wan Station. Once at Sheung Wan Station, go to Huiller Street Exit. Upon exit, turn left whereby you'll stop at a traffic light. Cross the small street, walk straight till you reach the next junction. Turn left at the junction and after about 10 steps the hotel entrance is on your left. I will definitely return to this Hotel in my next trip to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Idmd
Reviews.Content: Well located, close to the MTR, ferries, and many of the attractions. Clean, well kept, very helpful front desk staff. Free Wi-Fi. And even though it's on a busy street, the rooms are quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Comfort.”
Reviews.Author: Jason M
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a 10 minute walk from Central (Hong Kong Station, Star Ferry, and the IFC Mall) and is a 2 minute walk from the Sheung Wan metro stop. I could go wherever I wanted quickly. Location was fantastic. The price and quality were also great. The rooms were quite spacious for Hong Kong standards and it has free wi-fi. Good luck finding that in your more expensive hotels in Hong Kong. The beds were comfortable and you could not hear the traffic or noise outside the window. There is no room service or concierge. The staff will try to help answer any of your sight seeing questions, but it is best to come prepared. If you are looking for a view from your hotel room, you won't find it here. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice new hotel - very polite staff”
Reviews.Author: danimufe
Reviews.Content: New hotel, very well located, very clean and very polite staff. The WIFI signal was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: eskicorn
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms are small, they are new, clean and the bed is comfortable. Internet is free and fast. A simple but functional gym that doesn't look like a closet. Location is good - right next to the Sheung Wan MTR station, walking distance from LKF and easy tram / bus to Pacific Place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: octanou
Reviews.Content: Went to the bauhinia for vacation with my wife. I previously stayed in kowloon and tried to find another hotel in central this time. The Bauhinia is a nice small hotel with a very convenient location, very close to MTR and the various ferry piers. Its location is ideal to explore around the islands because of this. Room was quite large by HK standards and the staff friendly. Only downside to me is that they don't have breakfast, but not a deal breaker as there are a lot of options in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient position”
Reviews.Author: ByronO33
Reviews.Content: A very pleasant small hotel whose main feature is proximity to transport. It is an easy walk from IFC (and the airport express)- the skywalk extends to the block before the hotel. Also very close to the underground system and walking distance to the shopping areas and ferries. The rooms are spacious and very quiet (first floor rooms have no street noise at all) and there is a small but functional gym on the top floor. A few 24 hour convenience stores nearby - handy if you arrive in late and an easy walk to the mid-levels and the main shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “A good find!”
Reviews.Author: anginperth
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel by chance when surfing online. Turned out good! Location: Very convenient - 2-min walk to the Sheung Wan MTR station; trams stop opposite the hotel; buses stop 3 mins stroll away. Hotel is surrounded by eateries, including Starbucks; Pacific Coffee and other local cafes. There is reasonably good Dim Sum restaurant very nearby. A short walk brought us to the Shun Tak Centre across the road where one can catch the ferry to Macau. Coming in from the airport on the Airport Express, our cab ride from the Hong Kong station cost us all of HK$20. Ambience: Nice, cosy & quiet. The small front desk is manned by some efficient staff who could smile more:( The front desk has a bad design and the staff are often hidden behind the high counter. So they seldom noticed our comings and goings... Room: A good size, so much so mu husband could practise his putting! The bed was comfortable and though we had a street-view room, we could barely hear the noise because of the double windows. Bathroom: Enough for one person's use and it could have done with more counter space for my toiletries and perhaps a sliding main door to save space. However our friends had a room with a slightly bigger bathroom (with sufficient counter space and shower stand. No bathtub but that was ok with us. Will definitely stay there again if their rates are favourable.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, well located and good service”
Reviews.Author: JUANDDDD
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel is a good choice if you travel to HK for a weekend. The rooms are pretty big and comfortable and the service is good as well. As usually happens in HK, the walls are not very thick so you can hear your neighbor if he is not respectful :-) Good choice!

Reviews.Title: “great comfy hotel close to Central with good transport on MTR, tram and ferry.”
Reviews.Author: scamster71
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. Sheung Wan MTR on your doorstep but more fun taking tram if staying on HK side. 10mins walk to ferry station to cross to Kowloon side. Arriving on HK express from airport, only 5-10mins walk on footbridge to hotel. Faster than taking mtr and at Sheung Wan. Room was very comfortable and I loved the rain shower in the bathroom. Very relaxing after hard day walking and sightseeing. Disappointed that gym was not available due to renovations. Would have been nice if told upon check-in rather than a notice in the room on the table. Also one lift was not working but it didn't ruin my stay. This is a real gem of a hotel and would definitely recommend it

Reviews.Title: “always again”
Reviews.Author: TravelSam82
Reviews.Content: spent two nights in this hotel. hotel is located very close to public transport. very nice, clean and comfortable rooms with state-of-the art interior design. free internet in rooms, nice shower. over-all: fair price value, would def go back there. had only once breakfast, which was okay but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “A very good value boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MIWSing
Reviews.Content: We have been to Hong Kong many times and back in the good old corporate days, we only stayed at the big five star hotels. These days with our own company, we look for hotels that offer all the things we're used to but at a way different price level. I would have to say that for the money, I don't think you can beat The Bauhinia Hotel in Central - and we've stayed at quite a few hotels around this price-range in Hong Kong to compare. The location is fab - almost next to an MTR station (Sheung Wan station) which is a stop from Central. It's very close (less than 5 mins cab) to to the airport express train stop. Getting a cab in this area is easy and the cab can stop right outside the hotel (which is not always the case with boutique hotels in odd locations in HK). The hotel building is actually apartments but the lower floors have been converted into a hotel very tastefully. There really isn't much of a lobby, more like the sort of desk you'd see in an apartment building but once into the hotel itself, it's perfect. The rooms are a reasonable size and quite new which makes it nice. The bathroom is small and almost no space on the bench next to the sink for items, but that is really the only downside with the room. It has all the conveniences you require, ie amenities, iron and ironing board, hair-dryer, safe, etc. Whilst they don't really have a restaurant, we were offered access to the breakfast buffet free. It's a simple breakfast but fine for us - it consists of cereal options, pastries, eggs, yogurt, coffee, and juice. What I really liked was the room did actually have enough space to fit two people. Although it is on Connaught Rd, it has double glazing and much more quiet than most HK hotels I've been in and I heard nothing from any other room which means they got the soundproofing right - which is rare in some of these boutique hotels. Nearby the hotel are a plethora of inexpensive dining options. We walked up to the Hollywood Road area a few times for something more upmarket and that was only about 10 mins. I would definitely book this hotel again. Well done guys - you got things right! There are a lot of boutique hotels in Hong Kong that don't quite get the essential elements right, but this one does! One final thing - I accidentally left some clothes in a drawer when checking out. A day later I received an email from Reception to let me know of this. Fortunately I was passing back through Hong Kong so called in to pick up items a few days later! Haven't ever had this kind of service even from a 5 star large hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good location in Central.”
Reviews.Author: Camouflage_Aquila
Reviews.Content: It is a very new hotel located in a very convenient location in Central. The rooms are clean and well-kept and the cost per night is good. The staff were very helpful as well. Just do not expect much from the complimentary breakfast since they do not have a restaurant in-house. It consists of coffee/tea, some cereals, some bread. Not to worry: there are a ton of restaurants, cafes & grocery stores once you step outside. Clearly, this hotel is perfect for the business traveller or people who wish to be in a convenient location in Central.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: skiboyblue
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bauhinia Hotel Oct 11-16 2011. Really enjoyed this boutique hotel. It just opened in the summer and had amazing deals through Expedia. $US149 per night mid week. $US189 weekends. It was exceptionally clean, everything works (brand new hotel remember) and the staff were too new to be awful. The lobby is very plain (as expected in a 3 star), one elevator didn't work (ok because hotel is only 4 floors). They offered us a continental breakfast for one which was a bit odd because there was two of us. I guess they wanted us to pay for the other breakfast. We didn’t. Free internet and very comfortable bed, assorted pillows of different firmness, bar fridge and lots of free bottled water delivered when you call the front desk. Hotel had a magnificent (sic) view of a department store across the street with no windows. Front desk was very helpful. Hotel is located right next to a subway station and very close to train that goes to/from airport. Also very close to Soho restaurant and night club zone where food and fun are very reasonably priced and for sure there is something for everyone. A Starbucks is less than a block away from the hotel and the nearby 7-11 sells drinkable Australian wine. My wife and I travel a lot and are used to various hotel standards. Hong Kong is known for sky high prices. This little gem has a super location, super price and was just a please to stay at. We would definitely recommend this hotel to our friends and we will stay at the Bauhinia again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: freenah
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this hotel in Sept 2011 and I have to say, it was really, really fantastic value for money. The hotel is brand spanking new, very clean, tastefully decorated and feels very luxurious. They gave us a full size cot for our baby and let us check out as late as 4 pm (although technically they said we should leave by 2 pm) which was very handy given that our flight was at 8.30 pm. Staff were invariably friendly and helpful. A few things to note - there is no restaurant or kitchen as far as I know but this is no biggie in central HK. The view from our room was of a highway - pretty awful but this is not unusual in HK. The air conditioning unit (which was wonderfully powerful) sent the cooled air right above the bed which made me uncomfortable at night. Air con really needs to be positioned elsewhere in the room. All in all definitely a hotel to come back to if we ever return to HK.

Reviews.Title: “clean and nice hotel..totally worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlustsaggi
Reviews.Content: stayed in bauhinia hotel -central..and did not want to leave the hotel anymore--so comfortable and rooms are clean and spacious...so close to the subway train, and lots of nice restaurants nearby! will definitely stay there everytime we are in hk!

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel in Good location”
Reviews.Author: NickBkk
Reviews.Content: I try this hotel as its location is quite good next to Sheung Wan MTR Station. You can even walk from Hong Kong Station if you take the train from Airport as most of the way there is an elevated walkway. The room is nice as it is rather new. However the A/C flow goes directly into the bed, so this is not convenient at all. Fridge is empty so you can have your own drinks bought in any convenience store near by. There is a Starbucks one block from the Hotel as they do not have their own restaurant, so breakfast was not an option. In the room only tea bags are provided, so if you wanna have coffee in the room bring your own bags. The room and bathroom were clean and this is a comfortable place to stay, but it also depends what rates you get. Gym was not yet in operation and broadband internet was provided with a LAN cable. However I couldn't connect other devices to their wi-fi network.

HotelInfo.Name: The Bauhinia Hotel - Central
HotelInfo.Address: No.119-121 Connaught Road, Central, Hong Kong 0, China
